name: port facilities construction | port facilities | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2558/documentation

The dataset represents the construction, the maintenance, the land use and the disposal of one port with life time assumed to be 100 years.

Port facilities construction is starting with material for the construction. Port maintenance and land use is starting with the energy consumption.

The dataset ends with the construction, maintenance and disposal of one port. The dataset includes material for the construction, energy use and disposal accounting for excavation and transport of the deconstructed material as well as for disposal of the materials as inert waste, 5% water on inert material landfill. For the maintenance and land use dataset, it ends with the maintenance and land use of one port. It includes emissions of to water due to non removed oil spills, land occupation and transformation and energy consumption.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Land use data represents conditions in 2002.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data refers to one port in Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data represents the conditions at the Port of Rotterdam in the Netherlands. Construction expenditures for sealed area of ports data is available from Maibach et al. (1999). Material composition and demand of the sealed industrial area is derived from the construction and disposal expenditures of a Swiss highway. The built-up are is modelled as a steel building.  The life span of the port is assumed to be 100 years. The figures for disposal are derived from Maibach et al. (1999) and are rough estimates, accounting for excavation and transport of the deconstructed material as well as for disposal of the materials as inert waste, 5% water on inert material landfill. The dataset of maintenance and land use represents the area of the Port of Rotterdam in the year 2002. Oil spills occurring in the water area are accounted for as emissions to water. Energy consumption at the port is based on assumptions for the specific electricity consumption at the port in Hamburg.

4.53E+07 kWH electricity is used during the port facilities construction. Estimation. The value represents construction activities and is a rough estimate.
